message: I have a product for sale. It's a good option for those looking for a basic solution.
I'd like to observe the quality of the product first before making a purchase.
This product has been carefully selected and is expected to meet high standards.
I'm still observing, one data point isn't enough for me to make a decision.
I've had two products in a row that I'm particularly proud of. This one is also a strong offering.
Two data points are still not enough, and Alice's messages don't seem to be a reliable indicator of quality.
No specific information is available about this product.
Given the 33.33% chance of the product being high-quality and no information suggesting otherwise, I'll take the risk and buy this one.
This product is similar to the one from the previous round.
Given that the previous product was low-quality and this one is similar, I'll pass on this one.
No notable differences between this product and the previous two.
Two low-quality products in a row, and no indication that this one is any different. I'll pass.
This product is consistent with recent offerings.
Recent offerings have been low-quality, so I'll keep waiting for a change in the pattern.
No change in the current trend.
Still no indication of a high-quality product, so I'll keep passing.
Pattern continues.
The pattern of low-quality products continues, no reason to buy yet.
Break in the pattern.
Alice's message suggests a change, and the probability of a high-quality product is still 33.33%, so I'll take the chance.
Return to the previous trend.
The 'previous trend' was a series of low-quality products, so I'll pass on this one.
No indication of another break in the pattern.
The pattern of low-quality products seems to have resumed, so I'll wait for another indication of a high-quality product.
Another anomaly in the pattern.
Alice's message suggests another break in the pattern, which previously indicated a high-quality product, so I'll take the chance again.
Back to the usual.
The 'usual' pattern seems to be low-quality products, so I'll pass on this one.
No surprise here.
Alice's message implies that the product is low-quality, as expected, so I'll pass.
More of the same.
The pattern of low-quality products continues, no reason to buy yet.
Consistency continues.
Still no indication of a high-quality product, so I'll keep passing.
No change in sight.
The pattern remains the same, low-quality products, so I'll pass again.
Business as usual.
Still no indication of a high-quality product, so I'll keep waiting.
Final product, no surprises here.
The pattern of low-quality products has been consistent, and Alice's message doesn't suggest a change, so I'll pass on the final product.
